intro: Sageretia santapaui, commonly known as the Hawaiian sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight pubescence. Sageretia santapaui is an important species in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
